=*-@```8'`H`6@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`
M@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`
M*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@
M`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*
M`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`H`*`@`
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 1 &amp;#150; Summary of&#13;Significant Accounting Policies&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Organization and Nature of Business&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;iSatori Technologies, LLC (the&#13;&amp;#147;Predecessor Company&amp;#148;) was formed under the laws of the State of Colorado on June 14, 2004. On June 1, 2011, LS7 Products,&#13;LLC (d/b/a iSatori Global Technologies, LLC), a Colorado limited liability company and wholly owned subsidiary of the Predecessor&#13;Company (&amp;#147;LS7&amp;#148;), Eat-Smart, LLC a Colorado limited liability company and wholly owned subsidiary of the Predecessor&#13;Company (&amp;#147;Eat-Smart&amp;#148;), and Energize Solutions, LLC, a Colorado limited liability company and wholly owned subsidiary&#13;of the Predecessor Company (&amp;#147;Energize&amp;#148;), were merged with and into the Predecessor Company and Right Lane Publishing&#13;Inc., a Colorado subchapter S corporation and wholly owned subsidiary of the Predecessor Company (&amp;#147;Right Lane&amp;#148;), was&#13;distributed to Stephen Adele Enterprises, Inc., the Predecessor Company&amp;#146;s sole shareholder (collectively, the &amp;#147;Reorganizations&amp;#148;).&#13;On June 1, 2011, after consummation of the Reorganizations, the Predecessor Company converted to a corporation pursuant to the&#13;laws of the State of Colorado changing its name to iSatori Technologies, Inc. ( &amp;#147;iSatori Technologies&amp;#148;).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On April 5, 2012, iSatori Acquisition&#13;Corp. (&amp;#147;Merger Sub&amp;#148;), a Delaware corporation and wholly-owned subsidiary of Integrated Security Systems, Inc (&amp;#147;Integrated&amp;#148;),&#13;consummated a merger (the &amp;#147;Merger&amp;#148;) with iSatori Technologies, pursuant to a Merger Agreement, dated as of February&#13;17, 2012, by and among Integrated, Merger Sub and iSatori Technologies (the &amp;#147;Merger Agreement&amp;#148;). Pursuant to the Merger&#13;Agreement, iSatori Technologies was merged with and into Merger Sub with iSatori Technologies surviving as a wholly-owned subsidiary&#13;of Integrated.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Upon completion of the Merger,&#13;the holders of iSatori Technologies&amp;#146; common stock, and holders of equity instruments convertible into shares of iSatori Technologies&amp;#146;&#13;common stock, received an aggregate of approximately 8,410,973&#13;shares of Integrated common stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On June 29, 2012, Integrated&#13;completed a &amp;#147;short form&amp;#148; merger under &amp;#167;253 of the Delaware General Corporation Law pursuant to which iSatori Technologies&#13;was merged with and into Integrated with Integrated continuing as the surviving corporation. In connection with the merger, Integrated&#13;changed its name to iSatori, Inc. The trading symbol of the Company on OTCBB is &amp;#147;IFIT&amp;#148;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Prior to the Merger, Integrated&#13;was a company with virtually no operations. The Merger was accounted for as the equivalent to the issuance of stock by iSatori&#13;Technologies for the net monetary assets of Integrated. The accompanying financial statements therefore include the consolidated&#13;results of operations of iSatori Technologies and Integrated for periods subsequent to the Merger, and iSatori Technologies only&#13;for periods prior to the Merger. References to the financial operations of iSatori Technologies and the Predecessor Company are&#13;noted for the respective reporting periods as noted above. Unless otherwise specifically indicated, references to the &amp;#147;Company&amp;#148;&#13;(without further qualification) necessarily include iSatori Technologies, the Predecessor Company, Integrated and iSatori, Inc.&#13;for all applicable accounting periods. Since there was no change in the ownership of the business in connection with the Reorganizations,&#13;the assets and the liabilities of the Predecessor Company have been recorded on iSatori Technologies&amp;#146; financial statements&#13;at the same amounts at which they were reported on the financial statements of the Predecessor Company. All transactions between&#13;divisions and/or wholly owned subsidiaries of iSatori Technologies or the Predecessor Company have been eliminated in the financial&#13;statements. In addition, per the operating agreement of the Predecessor Company, no member was to have been liable for the debts,&#13;liabilities or obligations of the Predecessor Company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company is engaged in researching,&#13;designing, developing, contracting for the manufacture, marketing, selling and distributing of various nutritional and dietary&#13;supplement products for the general nutrition market. The &amp;#147;general nutrition market&amp;#148; may include such activities as&#13;body-building, physique enhancement (increase of lean body mass and decrease in fat mass) and enhanced athletic performance through&#13;increased strength and/or endurance and proper nutrition.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company does engage from&#13;time to time in funding of clinical studies with the objective of discovering and/or validating claims of new, efficacious products&#13;for the Company&amp;#146;s relevant market as well as providing necessary and appropriate substantiation for any claims which the&#13;Company may use in its marketing and advertising. The Company markets products which are under its control and which are in some&#13;way proprietary to the Company. Some of the Company&amp;#146;s products are the subject of trademarks owned by the Company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The accompanying consolidated&#13;financial statements include the accounts of the Company and the Predecessor Company: LS7; Right Lane; Eat-Smart; Energize; and&#13;Integrated for the respective reporting periods described above.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Basis of Presentation/Basis of Consolidation&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The accompanying consolidated financial Statements&#13;have been prepared on an accrual basis of accounting in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles in the United&#13;States (&amp;#147;GAAP&amp;#148;). The accompanying consolidated financial statements present the financial position and results of operations&#13;of the Company and include the amounts of the Company as well as the Predecessor Company and all wholly owned subsidiaries. Accordingly,&#13;all significant intercompany transactions have been eliminated.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Financial Instruments&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company considers all highly&#13;liquid debt instruments purchased with an original maturity of three months or less to be cash equivalents. Accordingly, cash&#13;and cash equivalents consist of petty cash, checking accounts and money market funds.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;As of December 31, 2012, the&#13;Company invested approximately$966 thousand with Horter Financial Group which, acted as investment advisor with and into the Alpha/Pimco&#13;Bonds Plus Total Return Fund. Pimco Corporation is one of the largest bond managers in the world. The Company utilized this Alpha/Pimco&#13;Bonds Plus strategy as a way to create a unique solution to a conservative investor&amp;#146;s dilemma: how to safely invest for income&#13;while increasing the asset base of the money invested at a rate greater than inflation on an after-tax basis.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The underlying&#13;security matures in three years. However, the Company has access and can liquidate the underlying security on 72-hours&amp;#146;&#13;notice. Thus, it has  been classified as a current asset. The investment strategy involves an&#13;investment in three separate &amp;#147;power periods&amp;#148;, late October, late November and late December of each&#13;year.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company invested $960&#13;thousand in this fund. As of December 31, 2012, the Company realized a net asset value gain of approximately $6 thousand. The&#13;total portfolio of the Company had a stated value therefore of $965,886.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;At December 31, 2012 and December&#13;31, 2011, the financial instruments of the Company and the Predecessor Company consisted principally of cash and cash equivalents,&#13;investments, receivables, accounts payable, certain accrued liabilities and long-term debt. The carrying amount of cash and cash&#13;equivalents, receivables, accounts payable and accrued liabilities approximates their fair value because of the short maturity&#13;of these instruments. The actual and estimated fair values, respectively, of the Company&amp;#146;s financial instruments are as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; font-size: 9pt&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font-size: 1pt&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 58%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 9%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 9%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Carrying&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;        &lt;p style=font-size: 8.5pt; text-align: center; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Amount&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-size: 8.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Trade Receivables and Credit Policy&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font-family: Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Trade&#13;receivables are uncollateralized customer obligations due under normal trade terms requiring payment generally within 10-60&#13;days from the invoice date. Accounts are considered delinquent when outstanding for more than 7 days past due date. The&#13;Company does not have a policy of accruing interest on past due accounts. Payments on trade receivables are applied as&#13;instructed per the customer, or to the earliest unpaid invoices. The allowance for doubtful accounts represents an estimate&#13;considered uncollectible and is determined based on management&amp;#146;s historical collection experience, adverse situations&#13;that may affect the customer&amp;#146;s ability to repay, and prevailing economic conditions. Specific accounts deemed&#13;uncollectible are written off periodically with subsequent receipts on previously written off accounts credited to bad debt&#13;expense. The allowance for doubtful accounts is $0 for the years ended December 31, 2012 and 2011, respectively. Receivables&#13;at each of the below respective periods consisted of the following:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; font-size: 9pt&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font-size: 1pt&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 61%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 2%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 16%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 2%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 2%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 17%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Times

 Serif&gt;Inventories of nutritional and&#13;dietary supplements are stated at lower of cost or market on a first-in, first-out (FIFO) basis as noted below:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; font-size: 9pt&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font-size: 1pt&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 60%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;December&#13;                                                                                  31,&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;        &lt;p style=font-size: 8.5pt; text-align: center; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;2011&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=background-color: #f3f3f3&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;675,999&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=background-color: #f3f3f3&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;1,292,105&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: #000000 3px double; vertical-align: top&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: #000000 3px double; vertical-align: bottom; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;757,250&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font-family: Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Notes&#13;Receivable&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font-family: Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Predecessor Company disposed of a dormant product line of vitamins in December, 2010. As part of the consideration in&#13;this divestiture, the Company received from the purchaser of this product line an  unsecured note in the amount of $170,000.&#13;The original note was due to be repaid on or before March 2014, where interest accrued principally at an annual rate of 5%,&#13;based upon the initial $170,000 principal and was payable monthly. As of March 2013, the note was novated and a new&#13;promissory note was issued to reflect a modification in the payment terms, which includes no interest. The total amount to be&#13;repaid is the open principal amount of $117,543 at December 31, 2012 with $0 interest and is due to be&#13;repaid on or before May 1, 2017. An allowance in the amount of $25,978 has been recorded against the aforementioned&#13;balance.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font-family: Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Property&#13;and Equipment&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font-family: Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Property&#13;and equipment are stated at cost. Depreciation for financial accounting purposes is computed using the straight-line&#13;method over the estimated lives of the respective assets, ranging from three to ten years. Maintenance and repairs are&#13;charged to expense when incurred. When property and equipment are retired or otherwise disposed of, the related cost and&#13;accumulated depreciation are thereafter removed from the respective accounts and any gain or loss is credited or charged to&#13;income. Total depreciation expense was $76,266 and $80,150 for the years ended December 31, 2012 and 2011, respectively.&lt;/font&gt; &lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Other Assets and Intangible&#13;Assets&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font-family: Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Other&#13;assets include intangible assets which are principally direct television advertising, websites, as well as deposits and are&#13;included in Deposits and other Assets. The Company periodically performs reviews of other assets including amortizable&#13;intangible and depreciable tangible assets, for impairment purposes using undiscounted cash flow methodology. Factors&#13;considered important that may trigger an impairment of assets review include, but are not necessarily limited to: significant&#13;changes in the manner of the use of its assets involving its strategy for its overall business; significant negative industry&#13;or economic trends; or underperforming business trends. These reviews may include an analysis of the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;current operations and capacity utilization in conjunction with an analysis of the markets in which the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;business is operating.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font-family: Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Intangible&#13;assets are discussed below. Amortization for financial accounting purposes is computed using the straight-line method over the&#13;estimated useful lives of the respective assets which range from three to ten years. Amortization for 2012 and 2011 totaled $3,259&#13;and $2,184, respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; font-size: 9pt&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font-size: 1pt&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 49%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Times

 Times

 Serif&gt;0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company operates predominantly&#13;as a distributor of its dietary supplement products through traditional large retailers and electronic intermediaries. Revenue&#13;from product sales is recognized upon transfer of title of the Company&amp;#146;s product to its customers. Net sales represent product&#13;sales less actual returns, allowances, discounts, and promotions. Sales to direct customers have an unconditional money back guarantee&#13;for thirty to sixty days after the date of purchase. Sales to several of the retail customers carry a &amp;#147;Sale or Return&amp;#148;&#13;Purchase agreement per contract, where if minimum sales thresholds are not met within required timeframe, the inventory will be&#13;returned to the Company for full credit. Other retail customers receive a percentage discount from invoice to cover any customer&#13;returns or damages they may incur. Returns, allowances and discounts were $1,717,211 and $1,891,607 for the years ending December&#13;31, 2012 and 2011, respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In addition, the&#13;Company provides allowances for sales returns based upon estimated and known returns. Product returns are recorded as a&#13;reduction of net revenues and as a reduction of the accounts receivable balance. The Company receives other revenues which&#13;includes but is not limited to shipping and handling charges which is charged to customers.&lt;/font&gt; &lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Cost of Sales&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company purchases its products&#13;directly from third party manufacturers. The Company&amp;#146;s cost of sales include product costs, cost of warehousing and distribution.&#13;Included in the cost of sales are shipping and handling costs that are incurred by the Company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;For the five months ended May&#13;31, 2011, the Predecessor Company operated as a limited liability company. Accordingly, the Predecessor Company&amp;#146;s taxable&#13;income (or loss) was allocated to its sole member. Therefore, no provision or liabilities for income taxes have been included&#13;in the financial statements for these relevant periods.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;However, on June 1, 2011, the&#13;Predecessor Company converted to a &amp;#145;C&amp;#146; corporation under the laws of the State of Colorado as of that date. Accordingly,&#13;the Company began to account for income taxes in accordance with the standards on income taxes. As prescribed by these standards,&#13;the Company utilizes the asset and liability method of accounting for income taxes. Under this asset and liability method, deferred&#13;tax assets and liabilities are recognized for the estimated future tax consequences attributable to differences between the financial&#13;statements carrying amounts of existing assets and liabilities, and their respective tax bases. Deferred tax assets and liabilities&#13;are measured using enacted tax rates in effect for the year in which those temporary differences are expected to be recovered&#13;or settled. See Note 5, &amp;#147;Income Taxes&amp;#148;. For the year ended December 31, 2011 and future years, the Company will file&#13;a consolidated federal income tax return. For state income tax purposes, the Company will also file a consolidated return in the&#13;states requiring the filing of such returns.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company has adopted the provisions&#13;of Codification Topic 740-10, &amp;#147;Accounting for Income Taxes,&amp;#148; (previously Financial Interpretation No. 48, &amp;#147;Accounting&#13;for Uncertainty in Income Taxes&amp;#148;), as of June 1, 2011. The implementation of this standard had no impact on the financial&#13;statements. As of both the date of adoption, and as of December 31, 2012, the unrecognized tax benefit accrual was zero.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Furthermore, since 2011 was the&#13;Company&amp;#146;s initial tax year, there are no prior federal or state tax returns subject to examination. Accordingly, the only&#13;taxable periods subject to examination by federal and state taxing authorities is the period ended December 31, 2012 and 2011.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Leases&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company leases its headquarters&#13;facility, comprising approximately 7,120 square feet, in Golden (metropolitan Denver), Colorado. The total rent expense for the&#13;year ended December 31, 2012 was $57,108 and $65,645 for 2011. The lease expired on September, 30, 2012, and a new lease was signed&#13;on November 1, 2012 for a term of four years and three months, which included the expansion of the lease space to a total of 10,044&#13;square feet to accommodate growth. The Company assumed the new addition in February of 2013. Future payments under the newly signed&#13;lease (with the expanded area) are $346,137. The Company also leases miscellaneous office and warehouse equipment. In most cases,&#13;management expects that in the normal course of business these leases will be renewed or replaced by other leases as applicable.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;i&gt;Future Payments&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-indent: 96px; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;2013&#13;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;$80,853&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-indent: 96px; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;2014&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;$82,863&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-indent: 96px; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;2015&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;$82,863&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-indent: 96px; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;2016&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;$82,863&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-indent: 96px; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;2017&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;$ &amp;#160;6,905&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Fair Value Measurements&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;ASC 820-10 establishes a framework&#13;for measuring the fair value of assets and liabilities and requires additional disclosure about fair value measurements. ASC 820-10&#13;defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in the principal (or most&#13;advantageous market) for the asset or liability in than orderly transaction between market participants at the measure date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company has a number of financial&#13;instruments, including cash, receivables, inventory, payables and debt obligations. The Company has issued warrants which are&#13;measured at fair value on a recurring basis. The Company estimates that the fair value of these financial instruments does not&#13;materially differ from the respective reported balance sheet amounts.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Accordingly, the adoption of&#13;ASC 820-10 has not had a material impact on the Company&amp;#146;s financial statements and disclosures.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Deferred Financing Fees&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Costs incurred in connection&#13;with the Company&amp;#146;s line of credit issued in July 16, 2012 are being amortized over the term of the debt repayment period.&#13;Accumulated amortization for the aforementioned indebtedness for the Company as of December 31, 2012 was $3,125.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Marketing&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company expenses all production&#13;costs related to advertising costs as they are incurred, including print and television when the advertisement has been broadcast&#13;or otherwise distributed. The Company records website costs related to its direct-to-consumer advertisements in accordance with&#13;FASB ASC 340-20 &amp;#147;Capitalized Advertising Costs&amp;#148;. In accordance with FASB ASC 340-20, direct response advertising costs&#13;incurred should be reported as assets and should be amortized over the estimated period of the benefits, based on the proportion&#13;of current period revenue from the advertisements to probable future revenue. As of December 31, 2012 and 2011, the Company had&#13;deferred $3,641 and $25,488 respectively, related to such advertising costs. This amount is included in Deposits and other assets&#13;and is being amortized over a three year period. In 2012 and 2011, marketing expenses totaled $1,996,325 and $2,450,464, respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Research and Development Costs&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Research and development costs&#13;are expensed when incurred. Research and development costs of $37,234 and $13,289 for December 31, 2012 and 2011, respectively,&#13;are included in selling and marketing expense.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Distribution, Shipping and&#13;Handling Costs&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Shipping costs on purchases&#13;and shipping and handling fees related to sales charged to customers are both included in cost of sales. As mentioned in&#13;Revenue Recognition, shipping and handling revenue billed customers are reflected in other revenues.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Insurance&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company has procured insurance&#13;for such areas as: (1) general liability; (2) product liability; (3) property insurance and (4) directors and officers liability.&#13;The Company is not insured for certain property and casualty risks due to the frequency and severity of such losses, the cost&#13;of insurance and the overall risk analysis performed by the Company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;As part of its medical benefits&#13;program, the Company contracts with a national service organizer to provide benefits to its employees for all medical, dental,&#13;vision and prescription drug services.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Concentration of Credit Risk&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Financial instruments that potentially&#13;subject the Company to concentration of credit risk consist principally of temporary cash investments and trade accounts receivables.&#13;Concentrations of credit with respect to trade receivables are limited due to the large number of customers comprising the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;customer bases and their dispersion across different geographic locations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company maintains cash balances&#13;at one financial institution located in Colorado and one in California. Accounts at these institutions are insured by the Federal&#13;Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) up to $250,000 per account. At times during the year, the Company&amp;#146;s bank balances have&#13;exceeded the FDIC limit. Management believes the risk of loss at such institutions to be minimal.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Customers whose revenue balance exceeds 10% of the&#13;account balance are disclosed below with corresponding accounts receivable balance outstanding at year end:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; font-size: 9pt&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font-size: 1pt&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 32%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 15%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 17%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 14%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;2012&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=3 style=border-bottom: #000000 1px solid; vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Customer&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; font-size: 8.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: #000000 1px solid; vertical-align: bottom; font-size: 8.5pt; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;%&#13;    of Revenues&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; font-size: 8.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: #000000 1px solid; vertical-align: bottom; font-size: 8.5pt; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;A/R&#13;    balance&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; font-size: 8.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Use of Estimates&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The preparation of the financial&#13;statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America requires management to&#13;make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements&#13;and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period. Actual results could differ from those estimates.&#13;Significant estimates include but are not limited to the fair value determination of derivative instruments, returns allowance&#13;and allowance for notes receivable.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Earnings (Loss) Per Share&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Net earnings (loss) per share&#13;is computed by dividing net income (loss) less preferred dividends for the period by the weighted average number of common stock&#13;outstanding during each period. Diluted earnings (loss) per share is computed by dividing net income (loss) less preferred dividends&#13;for the period by the weighted average number of common stock, common stock equivalents and potentially dilutive securities outstanding&#13;during each period.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Since the Company reflected a&#13;net loss for the years ended December 31, 2012, the effect of considering any common stock equivalents, if exercisable, would&#13;have been anti-dilutive. A separate computation of diluted earnings (loss) per share is not presented.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company has the following&#13;common stock equivalents as of December 31, 2012:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; font-size: 10pt&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font-size: 1pt&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 80%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Times

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: #000000 3px double; font-size: 9pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;14,303,545&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Recent Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Organization and Nature of Business&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;iSatori Technologies, LLC (the&#13;&amp;#147;Predecessor Company&amp;#148;) was formed under the laws of the State of Colorado on June 14, 2004. On June 1, 2011, LS7 Products,&#13;LLC (d/b/a iSatori Global Technologies, LLC), a Colorado limited liability company and wholly owned subsidiary of the Predecessor&#13;Company (&amp;#147;LS7&amp;#148;), Eat-Smart, LLC a Colorado limited liability company and wholly owned subsidiary of the Predecessor&#13;Company (&amp;#147;Eat-Smart&amp;#148;), and Energize Solutions, LLC, a Colorado limited liability company and wholly owned subsidiary&#13;of the Predecessor Company (&amp;#147;Energize&amp;#148;), were merged with and into the Predecessor Company and Right Lane Publishing&#13;Inc., a Colorado subchapter S corporation and wholly owned subsidiary of the Predecessor Company (&amp;#147;Right Lane&amp;#148;), was&#13;distributed to Stephen Adele Enterprises, Inc., the Predecessor Company&amp;#146;s sole shareholder (collectively, the &amp;#147;Reorganizations&amp;#148;).&#13;On June 1, 2011, after consummation of the Reorganizations, the Predecessor Company converted to a corporation pursuant to the&#13;laws of the State of Colorado changing its name to iSatori Technologies, Inc. ( &amp;#147;iSatori Technologies&amp;#148;).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On April 5, 2012, iSatori Acquisition&#13;Corp. (&amp;#147;Merger Sub&amp;#148;), a Delaware corporation and wholly-owned subsidiary of Integrated Security Systems, Inc (&amp;#147;Integrated&amp;#148;),&#13;consummated a merger (the &amp;#147;Merger&amp;#148;) with iSatori Technologies, pursuant to a Merger Agreement, dated as of February&#13;17, 2012, by and among Integrated, Merger Sub and iSatori Technologies (the &amp;#147;Merger Agreement&amp;#148;). Pursuant to the Merger&#13;Agreement, iSatori Technologies was merged with and into Merger Sub with iSatori Technologies surviving as a wholly-owned subsidiary&#13;of Integrated.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Upon completion of the Merger,&#13;the holders of iSatori Technologies&amp;#146; common stock, and holders of equity instruments convertible into shares of iSatori Technologies&amp;#146;&#13;common stock, received an aggregate of approximately 8,410,973&#13;shares of Integrated common stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On June 29, 2012, Integrated&#13;completed a &amp;#147;short form&amp;#148; merger under &amp;#167;253 of the Delaware General Corporation Law pursuant to which iSatori Technologies&#13;was merged with and into Integrated with Integrated continuing as the surviving corporation. In connection with the merger, Integrated&#13;changed its name to iSatori, Inc. The trading symbol of the Company on OTCBB is &amp;#147;IFIT&amp;#148;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Prior to the Merger, Integrated&#13;was a company with virtually no operations. The Merger was accounted for as the equivalent to the issuance of stock by iSatori&#13;Technologies for the net monetary assets of Integrated. The accompanying financial statements therefore include the consolidated&#13;results of operations of iSatori Technologies and Integrated for periods subsequent to the Merger, and iSatori Technologies only&#13;for periods prior to the Merger. References to the financial operations of iSatori Technologies and the Predecessor Company are&#13;noted for the respective reporting periods as noted above. Unless otherwise specifically indicated, references to the &amp;#147;Company&amp;#148;&#13;(without further qualification) necessarily include iSatori Technologies, the Predecessor Company, Integrated and iSatori, Inc.&#13;for all applicable accounting periods. Since there was no change in the ownership of the business in connection with the Reorganizations,&#13;the assets and the liabilities of the Predecessor Company have been recorded on iSatori Technologies&amp;#146; financial statements&#13;at the same amounts at which they were reported on the financial statements of the Predecessor Company. All transactions between&#13;divisions and/or wholly owned subsidiaries of iSatori Technologies or the Predecessor Company have been eliminated in the financial&#13;statements. In addition, per the operating agreement of the Predecessor Company, no member was to have been liable for the debts,&#13;liabilities or obligations of the Predecessor Company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company is engaged in researching,&#13;designing, developing, contracting for the manufacture, marketing, selling and distributing of various nutritional and dietary&#13;supplement products for the general nutrition market. The &amp;#147;general nutrition market&amp;#148; may include such activities as&#13;body-building, physique enhancement (increase of lean body mass and decrease in fat mass) and enhanced athletic performance through&#13;increased strength and/or endurance and proper nutrition.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company does engage from&#13;time to time in funding of clinical studies with the objective of discovering and/or validating claims of new, efficacious products&#13;for the Company&amp;#146;s relevant market as well as providing necessary and appropriate substantiation for any claims which the&#13;Company may use in its marketing and advertising. The Company markets products which are under its control and which are in some&#13;way proprietary to the Company. Some of the Company&amp;#146;s products are the subject of trademarks owned by the Company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Basis of Presentation/Basis of Consolidation&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Financial Instruments&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Trade Receivables and Credit Policy&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Trade receivables are uncollateralized customer obligations&#13;due under normal trade terms requiring payment generally within 10-60 days from the invoice date. Accounts are considered delinquent&#13;when outstanding for more than 7 days past due date. The Company does not have a policy of accruing interest on past due accounts.&#13;Payments on trade receivables are applied as instructed per the customer, or to the earliest unpaid invoices. The allowance for&#13;doubtful accounts represents an estimate considered uncollectible and is determined based on management&amp;#146;s historical collection&#13;experience, adverse situations that may affect the customer&amp;#146;s ability to repay, and prevailing economic conditions. Specific&#13;accounts deemed uncollectible are written off periodically with subsequent receipts on previously written off accounts credited&#13;to bad debt expense.&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font-family: Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Inventory Valuation&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font-family: Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Property&#13;and Equipment&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font-family: Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Other Assets and Intangible&#13;Assets&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font-family: Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Other&#13;assets include intangible assets which are principally direct television advertising, websites, as well as deposits and are&#13;included in Deposits and other Assets. The Company periodically performs reviews of other assets including amortizable&#13;intangible and depreciable tangible assets, for impairment purposes using undiscounted cash flow methodology. Factors&#13;considered important that may trigger an impairment of assets review include, but are not necessarily limited to: significant&#13;changes in the manner of the use of its assets involving its strategy for its overall business; significant negative industry&#13;or economic trends; or underperforming business trends. These reviews may include an analysis of the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;current operations and capacity utilization in conjunction with an analysis of the markets in which the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;business is operating.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company operates predominantly&#13;as a distributor of its dietary supplement products through traditional large retailers and electronic intermediaries.  Revenue&#13;from product sales is recognized upon transfer of title of the Company&amp;#146;s product to its customers. Net sales represent product&#13;sales less actual returns, allowances, discounts, and promotions. Sales to direct customers have an unconditional money back guarantee&#13;for thirty to sixty days after the date of purchase. Sales to several of the retail customers carry a &amp;#147;Sale or Return&amp;#148;&#13;Purchase agreement per contract, where if minimum sales thresholds are not met within required timeframe, the inventory will be&#13;returned to the Company for full credit. Other retail customers receive a percentage discount from invoice to cover any customer&#13;returns or damages they may incur.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Cost of Sales&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;For the five months ended May&#13;31, 2011, the Predecessor Company operated as a limited liability company. Accordingly, the Predecessor Company&amp;#146;s taxable&#13;income (or loss) was allocated to its sole member. Therefore, no provision or liabilities for income taxes have been included&#13;in the financial statements for these relevant periods.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;However, on June 1, 2011, the&#13;Predecessor Company converted to a &amp;#145;C&amp;#146; corporation under the laws of the State of Colorado as of that date. Accordingly,&#13;the Company began to account for income taxes in accordance with the standards on income taxes. As prescribed by these standards,&#13;the Company utilizes the asset and liability method of accounting for income taxes. Under this asset and liability method, deferred&#13;tax assets and liabilities are recognized for the estimated future tax consequences attributable to differences between the financial&#13;statements carrying amounts of existing assets and liabilities, and their respective tax bases. Deferred tax assets and liabilities&#13;are measured using enacted tax rates in effect for the year in which those temporary differences are expected to be recovered&#13;or settled. See Note 5, &amp;#147;Income Taxes&amp;#148;. For the year ended December 31, 2011 and future years, the Company will file&#13;a consolidated federal income tax return. For state income tax purposes, the Company will also file a consolidated return in the&#13;states requiring the filing of such returns.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Fair Value Measurements&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;ASC 820-10 establishes a framework&#13;for measuring the fair value of assets and liabilities and requires additional disclosure about fair value measurements. ASC 820-10&#13;defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in the principal (or most&#13;advantageous market) for the asset or liability in than orderly transaction between market participants at the measure date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company has a number of financial&#13;instruments, including cash, receivables, inventory, payables and debt obligations. The Company has issued warrants which are&#13;measured at fair value on a recurring basis. The Company estimates that the fair value of these financial instruments does not&#13;materially differ from the respective reported balance sheet amounts.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Deferred Financing Fees&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Marketing&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Research and Development Costs&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Distribution, Shipping and&#13;Handling Costs&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Concentration of Credit Risk&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Financial instruments that potentially&#13;subject the Company to concentration of credit risk consist principally of temporary cash investments and trade accounts receivables.&#13;Concentrations of credit with respect to trade receivables are limited due to the large number of customers comprising the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;customer bases and their dispersion across different geographic locations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Use of Estimates&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Recent Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
